intro: Hieracium praecox subsp. heteroschistum, commonly known as the early hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal rosettes of narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its yellow flowers bloom in the early summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It prefers moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed sites.
